html:
Updates

** E-commerce and cloud computing giant's shares AMZN.O up 2.7% at $3,316.29

** Morgan Stanley raises stock PT to $4,200 from $4,000

** Brokerage expects accelerating N.America retail and lower labor/supply chain pressures leading to better profitability and more investor conviction in AMZN's long-term share story in 2022

** Improved disclosure into AMZN's estimated ~$19 bln spent on engineers/yr (excluding Amazon Web Services) and emerging projects could help investors understand health of its core retail business

** "With AMZN now having lagged GOOGL/FB/MSFT/AAPL by anywhere from ~27% to 77% over the past 18 months due to concerns about decelerating growth, retail share loss...improved disclosure could be a positive (and needed) catalyst" - MS

** Estimates AMZN has roughly same number of engineers (ex-AWS) as Meta's FB.O total headcount and ~4.3x larger than total headcount of Snap Inc SNAP.N, Pinterest PINS.N and Twitter TWTR.N combined

** Separately, U.S. National Labor Relations Board says it will send unionization ballots to workers at an Amazon warehouse in Bessemer, Alabama on Feb. 4 (Full Story)

** AMZN added 2% last year vs Microsoft's MSFT.O gain of 51%, Apple's AAPL.O 34%, Meta's FB.O 23%


(Reporting by Anisha Sircar and Akash Sriram in Bengaluru)

(( Anisha.Sircar@thomsonreuters.com ;))
